Comments: Provides $150 million in new state funding in the current fiscal year in response to this public health emergency.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-32
Comments: Places a temporary restriction on non-essential veterinary procedures.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-31
Comments: Suspending the April 1 requirement for lower vapor pressure gasoline to ensure that gasoline supplies remain available to support essential state functions.

Title/Description: The Michigan National Guard will aid Food Banks.
Comments: In four communities across the state.

Title/Description: New program to expand Pandemic Unemployment Insurance.
Comments: To self-employed and gig economy workers.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-33
Comments: Formally declares a state of disaster, and recognizes the expanded scope of economic, educational, and civic dislocation caused by this public health emergency, and equips the administration to address fully the devastation.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-35
Comments: Orders all K-12 school buildings to close for the remainder of the school year — unless restrictions are lifted — and ensures continuing of learning by setting guidelines for remote learning.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-34
Comments: To clarify the temporary restrictions she placed on non-essential veterinary procedures as part of Executive Order 2020-32.

Title/Description: Executive order 2020-36
Comments: Prohibiting all employers from discharging, disciplining, or otherwise retaliating against an employee for staying home from work if they or one of their close contacts tests positive for COVID-19 or has symptoms of the disease. It also strengthens her “Stay Home, Stay Safe” executive order.

Title/Description: A partnership with the Detroit Lions, Pistons, Red Wings, and Tigers to release a call to action video encouraging nurses and doctors to bring their skills to Michigan.
Comments: As a way to volunteer and help bolster the number of health care professionals on the front lines.

Title/Description: Executive order 2020-37
Comments: Renews the restrictions on entry into care facilities and juvenile justice facilities, and requires them to use best efforts to facilitate remote visitations between individuals under their care and their loved ones, using phone or video conferencing software.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-38
Comments: Relaxes requirements for responding to FOIA requests made by mail or fax.

Title/Description: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) approved Michigan’s request for a Section 1135 Medicaid waiver.
Comments: The approved waiver enables Michigan to provide flexibilities in Medicaid provider screening and enrollment, lift prior authorization requirements, allow for reimbursement facility services in alternative settings, and waive public comment and tribal consultation requirements for certain changes to the Medicaid state plan.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-39
Comments: Temporarily suspends requirements regarding licensing and regulation of emergency medical services.

Title/Description: A partnership with health care providers providing critical support.
Comments: Such as the Henry Ford Health System, McLaren Health Care, Beaumont Health and the Detroit Medical Center.

Title/Description: The Governor created the Michigan Coronavirus Task Force on Racial Disparities.
Comments: Consists of leaders across state government and health care professionals from communities most impacted by the spread of coronavirus. The task force will provide the governor with recommendations on how to address disparities as they work to slow the spread and mitigate this public health crisis for certain communities in the state.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-41
Comments: Will protect the health and safety of residents by reducing unnecessary in-person contact, through the use of electronic signatures, remote notarizations, remote witness attestations and acknowledgments, and remote visitations.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-42
Comments: Extending her prior “Stay Home, Stay Safe” order through the end of April.

Title/Description: On April 13, self-employed workers, gig workers, 1099-independent contractors and low-wage workers affected by this public health emergency will be able to apply for federal Pandemic Unemployment Assistance.
A letter sent to Secretary Alex Azar and Administrator Seema Verma.
Comments: The Governor, along with 12 other Governors, sent a letter to Secretary Alex Azar and Administrator Seema Verma to ask that the Administration reconsider its decision and take swift action to allow for a special enrollment period of at least 30 days on the federal health care exchange.

Title/Description: A statement after Hyundai Motor America announced that the city of Detroit Department of Health will receive a $100,000 grant and 10,000 test kits to support the states drive-thru testing efforts.
Executive Order 2020-50
Comments: To establish procedures in long-term care facilities such as establishing COVID-19 designated regional hubs. The order also protects residents from being evicted and protects employees from retaliation for staying home when exhibiting symptoms.

Title/Description: A partnership with Ohio, Wisconsin, Minnesota, Illinois, Indiana and Kentucky to work in close coordination to reopen the economy in the Midwest region.
The Governor sent a letter to the Federal Emergency Management Agency.
Comments: Requesting cost-sharing requirements for emergency work to be waived in response to the public health emergency.

Title/Description: The Stay Home, Stay MIndful website in partnership with Headspace.
Comments: Headspace is a global leader in mindfulness and meditation, and the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services to provide a new mental health resource for residents.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-52
Comments: Temporarily suspends requirements for in-person examinations for renewals of pesticide certifications.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-54 and 2020-53
Comments: To extend previous orders that suspended evictions and enhanced restrictions on price gouging.

Title/Description: Executive Order No. 2020-55
Comments: Creating the Michigan Coronavirus Task Force on Racial Disparities.

Title/Description: A partnership with CVS Health.
Comments: To provide drive-through rapid testing to a select area of the state.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-56
Comments: Extending her previous order which gives pharmacists increased operational capacity and increases access to prescriptions.

Title/Description: The creation of the MiMortgage Relief Partnership with over 200 of Michigan’s financial institutions.
Comments: By providing affected borrowers with a 90-day grace period for all mortgage payment as well as other home ownership supports.

Title/Description: Executive order 2020-59
Comments: Extending the “Stay Home, Stay Safe” order. The order also requires people to wear homemade masks when they are in enclosed public spaces and eases some restrictions on the public (e.g. allows motorized boating).

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-60
Comments: To establish strategies to reduce exposure between customers and employees. The order also provides temporary relief by suspending licensing requirements and regulations for food service industries.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-63
Comments: Extends validity of existing personal protection orders that would otherwise expire.

Title/Description: The “Futures for Frontliners” program.
Comments: To provide a tuition-free pathway to college or a technical certificate to essential workers who don’t have a college degree.

Title/Description: Expanding the state’s Workshare Program.
Comments: To allow employers to reduce employee hours to receive weekly unemployment insurance benefits as well as the additional $600 Pandemic Unemployment Assistance weekly benefit.

Title/Description: A $130 million investment to create the Child Care Relief Fund for families affected by the public health emergency.
Comments: This fund allows child care providers to remain open, and ensure that costs associated with providing child care during the pandemic are not passed on to essential workers.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-65
Comments: To extend and clarify a previous Executive Order, which ordered all K-12 school buildings to close for instructional purposes to students for the remainder of the school year.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-66
Comments: Terminates the existing state of emergency and disaster declarations.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-67
Comments: Clarifies that a state of emergency remains in effect until May 28.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-68
Comments: Declares a state of emergency and a state of disaster.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-70
Comments: Allows the May 7 resumption of some types of work that present a very low risk of infection (e.g., construction and work performed outdoors).

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-71
Comments: Extends existing safety measures to protect consumers and employees at grocery stores and pharmacies until May 29, and extends temporary relief from licensing requirements for food sellers and pharmacies.

Title/Description: Executive Directive 2020-5
Comments: Creating the Michigan COVID-19 Office of Accountability within the State Budget Office. The office will provide oversight of all spending to address this crisis and must report regularly on its work to the governor and the state budget director.

Title/Description: Executive Orders 2020-73 and 2020-74
Comments: Extend two previous executive orders, which continue to temporarily allow e-signatures on official documents and remote notarizations and continue to temporarily suspend licensing, decal, and trip permit requirements.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-77
Comments: To extend Michigan’s Stay Home, Stay Safe order to May 28. In addition, this executive order requires manufacturing facilities to adopt measures to protect their workers from the spread.

Title/Description: A new partnership with Kroger Health.
Comments: To open a free drive-thru testing site.

Title/Description: The Governor detailed the six phases of her MI Safe Start Plan to re-engage Michigan’s economy.
The state would participate in the federal Unemployment Insurance Agency Work Share program.
Comments: To help offset budget implications as a result of the state’s response to the pandemic. As part of this program, impacted state employees will take two temporary layoff days per pay period beginning Sunday, May 17th until July 25th resulting in up to $80 million in decreased wage costs.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-83
Comments: Extends expanded disaster relief childcare services for essential workforce. She also signed Executive Order 2020-84 which extends protective measures for residents and staff in long-term care facilities.

Title/Description: The creation of the Return to Learning Advisory Council via Executive Order 2020-88.
Comments: Formalizing a process for determining how schools may be able to reopen in the fall.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-91
Comments: To ensure robust protections for Michigan workers and requires all businesses to adhere to strict safety guidelines to protect their workers, their patrons, and their communities from infection. To foster compliance, the governor also signed Executive Directive 2020-6 to appoint a Director of COVID-19 Workplace Safety within the Department of Labor and Economic Opportunity.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-92
Comments: Allowing for the reopening, in two regions, of retail businesses, office work that cannot be done remotely, and restaurants and bars with limited seating.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-93
Comments: Continues to allow pharmacists to dispense emergency refills of prescriptions for up to 60 days’ worth of supply for patients and require insurers to cover early refills for up to 90 days’ worth of supply during the ongoing pandemic.

Title/Description: The Governor released a statement after the Department of Technology, Management, and Budget released Michigan’s April unemployment numbers.
Comments: When the state had reached a peak number of positive cases.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-96
Comments: To reopen retail businesses and auto dealerships by appointment only.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-97
Comments: Updating a prior rule on workplace safety. Per the amended order, reopened outpatient health-care facilities, including clinics, primary care physician offices, and dental offices, will have to adopt strict protocols to prevent infection.

Title/Description: Temporary, $2-per-hour pay raise for direct care workers.
Comments: Providing Medicaid-funded in-home behavioral health and long-term care services to Michigan’s most vulnerable residents during the continuing pandemic.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-104.
Comments: Expands the types of medical personnel that can order a test, and creates a new category of community testing sites that offer testing to anyone with reason to be tested without an advance order, and without charging an out-of-pocket cost to any resident. Under this, anyone who leaves their home for work, or has symptoms of COVID-19 (even mild symptoms), may receive a test at a community testing location without securing a doctor’s order in advance.

Title/Description: The Governor launched an online dashboard that visually illustrates COVID-19 risks and trends in Michigan.
Comments: Providing residents with important information about the pandemic status where they live and work. The dashboard, designed and created by faculty at U-M School of Information and School of Public Health, presents risk and capacity indicators that inform implementation of the MI Safe Start Plan.

Title/Description: The Governor sent a letter to President Trump requesting an extension of Title 32 authority.
Comments: In order to use Michigan National Guard forces to combat the spread through July 31.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-110.
Comments: Rescinding her Safer at Home order and moving the entire state to phase four of the MI Safe Start Plan.

Title/Description: A request to extend use of Michigan National Guard to combat the pandemic.
Rescissions of executive orders on FOIA, hospital capacity, and emergency medical services, and the Michigan Department of Health and Human services loosened rules.
Comments: Loosened rules on who can visit patients in certain health care settings, as regions across Michigan continue to advance under the MI Safe Start plan.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-117.
Comments: Continues expanded access and capacity for child care services, giving priority to essential workforces such as health care workers, first responders, and others during the pandemic.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-120.
Comments: Lifts restrictions on overnight summer camps beginning June 15.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-124.
Comments: Extending her previous order which gives pharmacists increased operational capacity and expands access to prescriptions for residents who need them.

Title/Description: Michigan schools may resume in-person learning in phase 4 of the MI Safe Start plan.
The Governor announced that on June 30th, she will release an executive order and a robust document called “Michigan’s Return to School Roadmap”.
Comments: It will provide details on what will be required and what will be recommended for schools.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-127.
Comments: Extends the state of emergency declaration related to the COVID-19 pandemic until July 16.

Title/Description: The Governor signed a number of bills into, which increase access to health care for Michiganders through telemedicine and remote patient monitoring services, and delays the principal residence exemption application deadline under certain circumstances related to the state of emergency.
The Governor signed executive orders to protect Michigan Nursing Home residents and staff from the spread of the virus.
Comments: The orders extends existing safety measures to maintain restrictions regarding entry to care facilities and creates the bipartisan Michigan Nursing Homes COVID-19 Preparedness Task Force.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-134.
Comments: Extending the temporary suspension of evictions until July 15 and creating the Eviction Diversion Program, which outlines a process for renters to get fast rental assistance or establish a manageable payment plan to keep residents in their homes.

Title/Description: The Governor as well as majority leaders released a statement after reaching a bipartisan budget agreement.
Comments: Includes adjustments to the fiscal year 2020 budget and allocation of Coronavirus Relief Fund dollars.

Title/Description: The Governor signed Senate Bill 690.
Comments: Appropriates nearly $880 million in federal funding to support various COVID-19 response actions across the state, such as supporting direct care workers, small businesses restart grants, and enhanced connectivity, to respond to needs of the pandemic.

Title/Description: Executive Order 2020-143.
Comments: Closing indoor service at bars throughout most of lower Michigan.

Title/Description: Legislation for state investments to support research.
Comments: Authorizing the state to use an additional $21 million in state investments to support disease investigation, monitoring of the outbreak, public health information, and laboratory analysis of samples.

Title/Description: Authority to Governor to declare a peacetime emergency
Authority to Governor to allow employees to seek unemployment insurance or paid sick leave should they be quarantined due to COVID-19.
Restriction all state business travel for state employees.
Comments: Restriction made by Governor.

Title/Description: Executive order: 20- 02
Comments: Authorizing the closure of all prekindergarten through grade 12 schools.

Title/Description: Executive order: 20- 02
Comments: Requires schools to provide care for elementary-age children of health care professionals, first responders, and other emergency workers during previously planned school days

Title/Description: Executive order: 20- 02
Comments: Makes provisions for the continuity of mental health services and requires schools to continue providing meals to students in need.

Title/Description: Comprehensive guidance
Comments: For public school districts and charter schools on actions to take during these closures.

Title/Description: Guidance on worker protection for those impacted by COVID- 19.
Comments: Released by the Minnesota Department of Labor and Industry.

Title/Description: Statement on economic conditions
Comments: Stating that experts anticipate a U.S. recession beginning in the second quarter of 2020 and lasting until the first quarter of 2021.

Signed by the Governor, it provides $200 million toward an emergency and long-term grant program. Roughly $50 million will go to a response contingency account and $150 million will be used to establish a health care response fund.

Title/Description: Executive order: Protect individuals in veterans’ homes by restricting visitors
Executive order: Provide emergency relief
Comments: To motor carries to support food supplies

Title/Description: Executive order: Paid leave
Comments: Provided for state employees unable to work.

Title/Description: Executive order: 20- 09
Comments: Requiring health care providers to postpone elective surgeries and procedures and focus state health care capacity and equipment on needed resources.

Title/Description: Designated grocery employees as emergency workers.
Child Care
Comments: The state will partner with the YMCA to care for the school-age children of emergency workers.

Title/Description: Enrollment period for those without insurance.
Comments: A 30-day special enrollment period for qualified individuals who are currently without insurance during this public health emergency.

Title/Description: Executive Order
Comments: Ban price gouging.

Title/Description: Executive Order
Comments: Ensure critical services continue for vulnerable residents

Title/Description: Executive Order
Comments: Seek federal authority to waive or modify certain requirements for federal programs, such as the Family Investment Program, Medical Assistance, and MinnesotaCare.

Title/Description: Disaster assistance through the Small Business Administration loan.
Comments: Small businesses in Minnesota are now eligible to apply for disaster assistance through the Small Business Administration loan for economic injury.

Title/Description: The Governor tests positive for COVID- 19.
Comments: The Governor will self-quarantine for 14 days after learning he had contact with an individual who tested positive.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-14
Comments: Suspend evictions during the peacetime emergency.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20- 15
Comments: Establish Peacetime Emergency Loans for small businesses.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20- 16
Comments: Direct non-hospital entities to conduct an inventory of personal protective equipment

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-17
Comments: Clarify that Executive Order 20-09 on elective surgeries and procedures applies to veterinarians.

Title/Description: Emergency Loan Program for Minnesota small businesses.
Comments: Created by The Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20- 20
Comments: Directing residents to stay at home, and issued a list of activities for which it’s permissible to leave, such as for health and safety activities, necessary supplies and services, and for the care of others

Title/Description: A Stay Home MN public service announcement campaign.
Comments: Through local media channels.

Title/Description: Six Minnesota Initiative Foundations will launch an Emergency Child Care Grant Program.
Comments: To provide financial support to licensed child care providers in Greater Minnesota serving families of essential workers needed to respond to this public health emergency.

Title/Description: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) approved Minnesota’s request for a Section 1135 Medicaid waiver.
Comments: The approved waiver enables Minnesota to provide flexibilities in Medicaid provider screening and enrollment, lift prior authorization requirements, allow for reimbursement facility services in alternative settings, extend fair hearing timelines, and waive public comment and tribal consultation requirements for certain changes to the Medicaid state plan.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20- 21
Comments: Keep health care workers in the workforce by giving health-related licensing boards flexibility in licensing requirements.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20- 22
Comments: Allow the State Auditor to work with local governments to adjust reporting deadlines for various financial reports, to prevent municipalities from having to divert resources that should be used to respond to communities’ critical needs during this public health emergency.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20- 23
Comments: Amend Executive Order 20-07 to allow constitutional officers to implement leave for both classified and unclassified employees and to reassign and redeploy staff as needed.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20- 24
Comments: Provide hours of service and weight restriction relief for commercial vehicle drivers hauling livestock.

Allocates $330 million in COVID-19 aid and includes actions such as, expanding support to small businesses, supporting food banks, providing assistance for veterans, and creating peacetime emergency child care grants.

Title/Description: Stay at Home MN public service announcement campaign.
Executive Order 20-25
Comments: Extends licenses for first responders.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-26
Comments: Allows the medical cannabis program to continue safely serving residents.

Title/Description: Department of Human Services emergency temporary authority to change administrative and regulatory requirements.
Comments: For food assistance, home care, public health care and other state programs in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title/Description: The Governor will deliver his second State of the State address on April 5.
Minnesota’s health plans have agreed to waive cost-sharing for treatment of COVID-19.
Executive Order 20-27
Comments: Tto lift hours of service requirements for truck drivers transporting livestock feed or fertilizer, in order to support Minnesota’s agriculture community while they work to keep residents fed during this public health emergency.

Title/Description: A new State of Minnesota COVID-19 dashboard.
Comments: Tracks the virus in Minnesota and provides the latest available data on available ventilators, ICU beds, personal protective equipment, and testing. The dashboard will be updated daily and is available at https://mn.gov/covid19/.

Title/Description: The Governor sent a letter to President Donald Trump requesting a major disaster declaration.
Comments: To authorize emergency protective measures.

Title/Description: Veterans in the state may be eligible for financial assistance grants
Comments: Of the $6.2 million in total funding that was included in the COVID-19 response package passed by the legislature, veterans in the state may be eligible for financial assistance grants from this package.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-28.
Comments: Authorize out-of-state mental health providers to provide telehealth services to Minnesota patients.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-29.
Comments: Provide immediate relief to employers and unemployed workers through streamlined unemployment insurance and assistance in the qualifying of additional unemployment insurance funds.

Title/Description: The launch of a Discrimination Helpline.
Comments: Due to rising discrimination against the Asian American community, the Governor announced the launch of a Discrimination Helpline to reinforce the state’s efforts to protect the civil rights of Minnesotans during this public health emergency.

Title/Description: An ordering process specifically for child care providers.
Comments: The Governor’s Children’s Cabinet, in partnership with CUB Foods and its parent company United Natural Foods Inc., has set up an ordering process specifically for child care providers by leveraging its extensive statewide supply chain network.
Expanding workers’ compensation eligibility for emergency first responders and front-line workers by allowing them to qualify for workers’ compensation benefits if they test positive.

Title/Description: The Governor extended the Stay Home Order until May 4.
Comments: It also included more occupations in his designation of what is essential.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-34.
Comments: To help protect Minnesota’s first responders by sharing information between the Minnesota Department of Health, the Minnesota Department of Public Safety, and 911 Dispatchers and first responders. It also directs the Commissioner of Health to develop protocol for the sharing of information while safeguarding patient privacy.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-35.
Comments: Extending the peacetime emergency in Minnesota for 30 days.

The fourth legislative package passed and signed this month that delivers funding tohelp residents with and without insurance afford COVID-19 testing and care, streamline telemedicine, and extend administrative deadlines.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-36
Comments: Instituting a hiring freeze and implementing salary cuts for the Governor, his Chief of Staff, and cabinet members.

Title/Description: The state received close to $1 billion in funds from the CARES Act
Comments: It will be used to help offset the state’s costs associated with responding to the coronavirus pandemic.

Title/Description: A partnership with Ohio, Wisconsin, Michigan, Illinois, Indiana and Kentucky to work in close coordination to reopen the economy in the Midwest region.
Executive Order 20-37
Comments: Extends exemptions for vehicles and drivers providing assistance for COVID-19 emergency relief efforts for 30 days.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-38
Comments: Expands allowable outdoor recreational activities.

Title/Description: legislation allowing takeout sales of beer and wine from bars and restaurants during the COVID-19 pandemic.
a week-long homemade mask drive
Comments: To encourage Minnesotans to create homemade masks for donation and highlight the importance of frontline workers.

Title/Description: The Governor, along with members of the health care delivery system, Mayo Clinic, and University of Minnesota, launched a statewide testing strategy.
Comments: To test all symptomatic people, isolate confirmed cases, and expand public health surveillance tools.

Title/Description: The extension of distance learning through the end of the school year.
Plans for safely returning as many as 100,000 workers to their jobs.
An explanation of the different factors that determine the gradual re-opening.
A new website to help Minnesotans find a testing location within their community.
Comments: The website also provides an interactive screening tool to help users determine if they need a test.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-46
Comments: Authorizing certain out-of-state healthcare professionals to provide aid in the state during peacetime emergency.

Title/Description: The Governor finalized a lease agreement for an alternate care site in the state.
Comments: To provide low-level medical care for monitoring, should it be needed during the pandemic.

Title/Description: The Governor extended the Stay Home Order in Minnesota until May 18.
Executive Order 20-50
Comments: Exempting federal, tribal, state, and local COVID-19 relief funds from being automatically intercepted by creditors and debt collectors.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-49
Comments: Permitting food trucks to operate at up to six highway rest stops in Minnesota.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-51
Comments: providing a roadmap for safely restarting elective surgeries.

Title/Description: a statement on the state’s economy.
Comments: describing that the economy has been “badly damaged”.

Title/Description: A new five-point plan.
Comments: To provide more robust support to our state’s long-term care facilities.

Title/Description: The Governor called on the Legislature to replenish and extend the Minnesota COVID-19 fund.
Comments: The Minnesota COVID-19 fund which currently has $65 million remaining which is set to expire on May 11.

Title/Description: The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) approved Minnesota’s second request for a Medicaid 1135 waiver.
Comments: The waiver allows Minnesota to waive consent requirements for Home and Community-Based Services(HCBS), reimburse for HCBS services provided at an entity that also provides case management services, allow for HCBS in additional settings, and to modify timelines for levels of care determinations.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-52
Comments: allowing students in critical care sectors to attend classes for needed in-person training or testing in order to graduate.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-57
Comments: authorizing and directing the Commissioner of Education to provide a safe and effective summer learning environment for students, with the option to provide a hybrid of distance and in-school learning or to continue distance learning.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-58
Comments: allowing the Public Utilities Commission to hold remote meetings as necessary, and Executive Order 20-59 to extend exemptions for vehicles providing assistance for COVID-19 emergency relief efforts for 30 days.

Title/Description: The phases in the Governor's Stay Safe Plan.
Comments: Including a move to allow limited outdoor dining at restaurants and bars starting June 1.

Title/Description: The Governor's administration has partnered with Minnesota faith leaders to develop a plan for places of worship to reopen safely.
The Governor signed 21 bills into law.
Comments: Including measures to support farmers and meat processing plants through COVID-19.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-63.
Comments: Outlines the second phase of Stay Safe MN.

Title/Description: Phase III of the Stay Safe MN plan, including a gradual turn of the dial.
Comments: To allow cautious and safe re-opening of indoor dining, gyms, and entertainment venues beginning Wednesday, June 10.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-75
Comments: Extending the COVID-19 peacetime emergency.

Title/Description: H.F. 5 into law, which provides $62.5 million in grants for small businesses impacted by the pandemic.
Comments: Half of the funding will go to Greater Minnesota businesses, at least $10 million to go to minority-owned businesses, $2.5 million will go to veteran-owned businesses, $2.5 million will go to women-owned businesses, and $2.5 million will support cultural malls.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-76
Comments: Extends the provisions outlined in Executive Order 20-60, which provide emergency relief from regulations for motor carriers and drivers operating in Minnesota in order to safely and efficiently transport livestock.

Title/Description: The Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development is now accepting applications for the $62.5 million Small Business Relief Grants Program.
Comments: For businesses impacted by the pandemic.

Title/Description: The state has completed more than half a million tests and has reached the milestone of developing a daily capacity of 20,000 COVID-19 molecular tests.
Mississippi Coronavirus (COVID-19) Preparedness and Response Planning Steering Committee
State of Emergency
Executive order: Active the National Guard to support mobile testing units;
Executive order: Work remotely.
Comments: Require agencies to keep essential employees and send non-essential employees home.

Title/Description: Executive order: Distance learning and free or reduced lunches.
Comments: Requests schools develop distance learning protocols and continue providing free or reduced lunches

Title/Description: Executive order: Paid leave
Comments: For state and local employees who miss work due to COVID-19.

Title/Description: School closures
Comments: Closing of all public schools through April 17 as well as end-of-year tests and accountability measures.

Title/Description: Activated the National Guard.
The Small Business Administration approved the state’s request for an Economic Disaster Declaration.
Executive Order 1462
Comments: Gives the Mississippi Department of Employment Security the ability to expedite payments to unemployed Mississippians and relax collection requirements on employers.

Title/Description: The Governor is not currently ordering businesses to close, or for individuals to stay home.
The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) approved Mississippi’s request for a Section 1135 Medicaid waiver.
Comments: The approved waiver enables Mississippi to provide flexibilities in Medicaid provider screening and enrollment, forgo certain pre-admission screening and annual resident review assessments, lift prior authorization requirements, allow for reimbursement facility services in alternative settings, and extend fair hearing and appeals timelines.

Title/Description: Executive Order No. 1463
Comments: Limits mass gatherings to 10 or less.

Title/Description: Executive Order No. 1463
Comments: Suspends dine-in services at restaurants and bars.

Title/Description: Executive Order No. 1463
Comments: Restricts visits to hospitals, nursing homes, and long-term care facilities.

Title/Description: Executive Order No. 1463
Comments: Directs businesses to allow employees to work from home.

Title/Description: Executive Order No. 1463
Comments: Defines essential businesses.

Title/Description: Supplement to Executive Order No. 1463 to ensure uniform statewide parameters.
Comments: No measures can be adopted that are less restrictive than the executive order.

Title/Description: Supplement to Executive Order No. 1463 to ensure uniform statewide parameters.
Comments: Any existing local measures can remain in effect under the executive order, as long as they provide the same minimum standards established in the executive order and do not impose restrictions that would prevent essential services from operating.

Title/Description: Shelter in place order.
Comments: For a county in the state due to increased cases in that region.

Title/Description: Stay at home order for the entire state.
A Presidential Major Disaster Declaration.
Waive the in-person requirement for notarizing documents in Mississippi for the duration of the COVID-19 emergency.
Statewide burn ban.
Comments: Due to requests from the Mississippi Forestry Commission, which would ease the strain on emergency responders who are responding to the public health emergency.

Title/Description: Executive Order.
Comments: Restricting all non-essential elective surgeries and medical procedures.

Title/Description: Executive Order.
Comments: Creates additional protections from civil liability for healthcare workers and facilities assisting outside their normal operations in response to this public health emergency.

Title/Description: Schools in Mississippi will remain closed for the rest of the school year.
Two new programs that aim to help those at risk of losing their homes and to provide essential workers access to childcare.
Extended the state’s stay-at-home order by one week.
The creation of the Governor’s Commission for Economic Recovery.
Comments: It is also called Restart Mississippi.

Title/Description: Pandemic Unemployment Assistance is now available for residents.
A Safer at Home order which encourages residents to stay home.
Comments: Eases some restrictions on essential business closures.

Title/Description: Executive Order
Comments: Amends the state’s Safer At Home order, until May 11. The Governor also laid out strict social distancing guidelines to begin the process of reopening restaurants and allowing outdoor recreation.

Title/Description: A plan for salons, barbershops and gyms to reopen.
Executive Order
Comments: Waives the one-week waiting period to receive unemployment benefits for all claims filed from March 8, 2020 to December 26, 2020. The Governor is also increasing the $40 earning allowance to $200 from May 3, 2020 until June 27, 2020. For employers, the Governor waived any interest from April 1, 2020 to June 27, 2020 on all collection activities suspended under the Executive Order.

Title/Description: Additional social distancing measures for seven counties.
Comments: Identified as hotspots throughout the state.

Title/Description: Lifting a suspension on evictions on June 1.
Comments: Allows law enforcement to restart enforcement of eviction orders.

Title/Description: Executive Order 1486
Comments: Allows more businesses to open, including dance studies, parks, and fishing tournaments.

Title/Description: The Governor released social distancing and sanitation guidelines for in-person worship services to safely resume.
Comments: Across the state.

Title/Description: A church in the state had been destroyed by a suspected arson fire.
Comments: After the pastor filed a lawsuit challenging the city on restrictions amid the pandemic.

Title/Description: The Governor has extended the Safer at Home order for another week.
Comments: allowing outdoor recreation facilities to reopen with restrictions.

Title/Description: All businesses in the state can reopen as of June 1.
The final orders that had closed businesses because of the pandemic.
Two executive orders which extends the safe-return order.
Comments: It went into effect June 1, by an extra two weeks, and the second order moves to get government employees back to work.

Title/Description: Due to an increase in fraud, the Governor addressed the state’s response to unemployment fraud schemes.
Comments: Unemployment fraud schemes related to the pandemic.

Title/Description: The state’s reopening plan is currently on pause.
Governor Parsons signs a state of emergency declaration.
Guidance limiting mass gathering
Comments: Of 50 people or more individuals.

Title/Description: Casinos will be closed.
A total of 432 public school districts and charter schools either have closed or will close soon.
Visitation restrictions.
Comments: Facilities who have a large concentration of senior citizens encouraged to place visitation restrications or consider closures.

Title/Description: Executive order: 20- 04
Comments: Enables doctors to diagnose and treat patients through telemedicine.

Title/Description: Executive order: 20- 04
Comments: Extends the hours commercial drivers can operate on Missouri roadways in order to deliver essential supplies.

Title/Description: Executive order: 20- 04
Comments: Removes barriers to entering the education profession in order to mitigate teacher shortages.

Title/Description: The Missouri State Emergency Management Agency and the Department of Economic Development to seek assistance.
Comments: Done through the Small Business Administration’s Economic Injury Disaster Loan Program.

Title/Description: Order on all residents to practice social distancing.
Comments: The Governor directed the Director of the Department of Health & Senior Services to issue an order on all residents to practice social distancing.

Title/Description: Flexibility for the Missouri Department of Social Service.
Comments: To provide reassurance and clarity regarding services for the states most vulnerable populations.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-05
Comments: Suspending any prohibition on the sale of unprepared food by restaurants to the public.

Title/Description: Governor's administration is continuing to streamline government process.
Comments: Governor's administration is continuing to streamline government process through a multitude of actions such as waiving some existing statutes to assist pharmacists in dispensing medications and extending the time a temporary permit is valid for nurses.

Title/Description: New guidance related to school closures, meal delivery for students, childcare, financial aid, scholarship requirements, and social distancing protocols.
Comments: Released by the Governor, along with the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education and Department of Health and Senior Services

Title/Description: Request for the President approve the state’s Major Disaster Declaration.
Comments: In addition to other activities, the declaration requested FEMA’s Public Assistance Program to assist local governments and qualifying nonprofit agencies with emergency response expenses.

Title/Description: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services approved Missouri’s request for a Section 1135 Medicaid waiver.
Comments: The approved waiver enables Missouri to provide flexibilities in Medicaid provider screening and enrollment, forgo certain pre-admission screening and annual resident review assessments, lift prior authorization requirements, allow for reimbursement facility services in alternative settings, extend fair hearing and appeals timelines, and waive certain submission deadlines and public comment requirements for Medicaid State Plan Amendments.

Title/Description: Governor emphasized the importance of mental health during this public health emergency
Free, temporary overweight permit that allows haulers to transport up to 100,000 pounds on any Missouri highway.
Comments: Announced by the Governor and the Department of Transportation.

Title/Description: President approved his request for a major disaster declaration.
Executive Order 20-06
Comments: Mobilized the Missouri National Guard, to assist with community-based testing, intrastate transportation of personnel and equipment for medical or testing support, logistical support for state responders, and continued assessment, and construction of temporary medical facilities. This order also directed the DHSS Director to prohibit the operation of coin-operated amusement devices, such as slot machines, and closed state park campgrounds and lodging through April 30.

Title/Description: Full reciprocity for physicians and surgeons from other states.
Comments: Approved a waiver granting full reciprocity for physicians and surgeons from other states who wish to assist Missourians during this public health emergency.

Title/Description: The state’s National Guard is seeking alternate care sites for COVID-19 patients.
$180 million in expenditure restrictions to ensure a balanced state budget and the necessary funds to respond to this public health emergency.
Comments: Which include reduced funding for several state departments including the Department of Higher Education and Workforce Development, Department of Transportation, Office of Administration, Department of Natural Resources, and the Department of Economic Development.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-07.
Comments: Suspends late penalties for concealed carry license renewals.

Title/Description: Statewide stay at home order.

The Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services, the Missouri State Emergency Management Agency, and the Missouri Department of Economic Development’s Missouri One Start Division partnered to recruit medical professionals.
Comments: Recruited medical professionals not currently part of the workforce to join a specialized state team that responds to critical health emergencies.

Title/Description: The Missouri Department of Health & Senior Services, the Missouri Department of Agriculture, and President of Sysco Foods announcedupdates to the state’s food supply chain.
Executive Order 20-08.
Comments: Suspending a statutory requirement that a notary public must conduct the notarization in person.

Title/Description: The state has received its first operational guidance related to the Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation (FPUC) program under the CARES Act.
Comments: Funds will provide a $600 federal supplement to those that are unemployed.

Title/Description: Missouri is moving forward with its first alternate care site to assist hospitals in the St. Louis region treating an increased number of patients.
All public and charter school buildings will remain closed through the remainder of the academic year.
Supplemental budget passed by the Missouri General Assembly.
Comments: Provides access to federal funding under the CARES Act. This funding will be used to buy more personal protective equipment and provide alternate medical locations as well as staffing. A working group was also established to help make recommendations on the best use of the funding.

Title/Description: The Governor highlighted efforts of hospitals across the state in responding to this public health emergency.
Comments: Along the lines of treatment and testing, and announced that DHSS is encouraging individuals who are fully recovered to donate plasma to help current COVID-19 patients.

Title/Description: Missouri is the first state in the nation to receive a federal grant for rural transit.
Comments: Totaling $61.7 million dollars that will be used for operating expenses and capital assistance.

Title/Description: Missouri will receive a $152.4 million grant for 75 state airports.
Comments: To help respond to this public health emergency, with funds available for operating costs (salaries, utilities, etc.), and airport development.

Title/Description: Extending the state’s stay at home order until May 3.
The state’s initial framework to help Missouri safely and gradually move into the recovery phase.
16 broadband development projects will receive a total of $3.05 million through the state of Missouri’s broadband grant program.
Comments: Additionally, the Department of Economic Development has also created a web page that lists broadband discounts, waivers and free resources available to Missourians during the pandemic

Title/Description: The “Show Me Strong” Recovery Plan to safely and gradually reopen the state’s economy.
Over $47 million in additional expenditure restrictions to ensure a balanced budget.
Comments: Restrictions include reduced funding for nine state agencies, the Office of the Attorney General, and the General Assembly.

Title/Description: The launch of a new tool developed by Google to help health care providers connect with Missouri manufacturers and suppliers of personal protective equipment.
The deployment of Battelle Critical Care Decontamination System.
Comments: To assist with N95 mask shortages.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-09
Comments: Extending the state of emergency.

Title/Description: The first phase of the “Show Me Strong Recovery” Plan.
Comments: To reopen economic and social activity starting May 4, 2020.

Title/Description: The Department of Health and Senior Services issued the Economic Reopening Health Order.
Comments: Provides further guidance on reopening plans.

Title/Description: The Governor highlighted data supporting the state’s “Show Me Strong Recovery” Plan.
Comments: Additionally, how this data helps to inform the state’s reopening as they monitor pillars of the plan and inform its decisions.

Title/Description: The state’s COVID-19 testing capacity.
Comments: Stating that capacity has increased as part of the Governor’s Show Me Strong Recovery plan.

Title/Description: Housing assistance and resources available to residents through the CARES Act.
Comments: Including community development block grants and emergency solutions grant program.

Title/Description: The four pillars of the state’s “Show Me Strong Recovery Plan”.
Comments: Emphasized that Missouri is prepared to safely reopen on May 4.

Title/Description: Executive Order 20-10
Comments: Extending four previous Executive Orders (on regulatory burdens, food service, national guard efforts, and notary services) and announced that the state will be dispersing CARES Act funding to local governments.

Title/Description: The importance of safely re-engaging in the economy and supporting Missouri businesses.
Missouri will receive $66 million for child care assistance.
$1.5 million for food banks from the federal CARES Act funding.
The Governor, joined by the head of the Pfizer Biotherapeutics and Pharmaceutical Sciences Department.
Comments: Highlighted work being done to manufacture a vaccine.

Title/Description: The economic recovery portion of the “Show Me Strong” Recovery Plan.
Comments: Including funding allotments from the paycheck protection program, and opportunities being explored to assist businesses with training and workforce needs.

Title/Description: A series of testing priorities designed to detect and rapidly contain potential outbreaks.
Comments: As the state gradually reopens its economy.

Title/Description: The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) approved Missouri’s second request for a Medicaid 1135 waiver.
Comments: The waiver allows Missouri to waive consent requirements for Home and Community-Based Services(HCBS) and reimburse for HCBS in additional settings.

Title/Description: The Governor emphasized the importance of testing to economic recovery in the state.
Comments: The state’s goal within the next week is to increase testing to 7,500 tests per day.

Title/Description: The launch of a new COVID-19 dashboard.
Comments: Containing Missouri-specific data from across the state.

Title/Description: A plan to rapidly increase testing volume to 7,500 tests per day.
Comments: The plan focuses on three main testing strategies – box-in outbreaks, sentinel testing, and community sampling.

Title/Description: Phase 1 of the state’s “Show Me Strong Recovery” Plan has been extended from Sunday, May 31, 2020, through Monday, June 15.
Comments: Extending Phase 1 of the plan through June 15 aligns with Governor Parson’s other Executive Orders as well as the state of emergency in Missouri.

Title/Description: Over $209 million in additional expenditure restrictions due to the pandemic.
Comments: Includes reduced funding for the Office of Administration, the Department of Corrections, the Department of Health and Senior Services, the Department of Social Services, the Department of Higher Education and Workforce Development, and the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education.

Title/Description: SB 631
Comments: Includes a provision giving voters who have contracted or are at-risk of contracting COVID-19 the option to cast an absentee ballot without notarization.

Title/Description: The Governors’ Coronavirus Task Force
Comments: To coordinate efforts across state government responding to COVID-19.

Title/Description: State of emergency
Comments: Gives Governor Bullock the authority to use $16 million dollars in state funds and additional personnel from the National Guard to respond to COVID-19.

Title/Description: Guidance of school closures.
Comments: Closing all public elementary and secondary education schools,

Title/Description: Guidance of limitations of mass gatherings.
Comments: Limiting mass gatherings of more than 50 people

Title/Description: Guidance visitation limitations.
Comments: suspending visitors from all nursing homes

Title/Description: Eight Montana Army National Guard soldiers
Comments: To assist in the arrival and transport of Montana residents returning from quarantine.

Title/Description: Eligibility for health care coverage
Comments: Uninsured residents who receive a recommendation from their provider will be eligible to receive coverage for COVID-19 testing and treatment.

Title/Description: Emergency rules
Comments: To make unemployment benefits accessible to workers who have been laid off due to COVID-19, while also waiving the waiting period for receiving benefits.

Comments: To ensure Montana Medicaid patients receive quality health care in their homes to prevent unnecessary gatherings at health care facilities.

Title/Description: Directive requiring Montanans to stay home.
Directive temporarily closes all nonessential businesses and operations.
14-day quarantine for travelers arriving from another state or country to Montana.

Title/Description: Protections to lessen the economic impacts of this public health emergency.

Comments: Under the Montana Facility Finance Authority Act, to remain open and acquire the supplies needed to respond to this public health emergency.

Title/Description: CARES Act.
Comments: Through the flexibility and funding of the CARES Act, he will extend federal food assistance to more than 100,000 Montanans, increase food supplies at emergency food pantries and food banks, and streamline nutrition assistance for new mothers and children.

Title/Description: Measure that will allow first responders to be notified in advance of potential exposure to COVID-19.
Comments: As well as, ensures they can take appropriate measures to safely perform their duties and avoid exposing other patients.

Comments: In order to access new funding coming to the state through the CARES Act.

Title/Description: Extended, through April 24, directives he previously issued to protect residents.
The state successfully sold $33 million in bonds at a historically low interest rate.
Comments: Allow the state to begin construction projects that will create jobs and stimulate the economy after this public health emergency.

Title/Description: His essential business designation to include childcare workers.
Comments: In order to ensure consistent care for children of other essential workers.

Title/Description: A directive to provide emergency rental assistance.
Comments: To help families with limited financial resources make ends meet during this unprecedented economic situation. The program also includes relief funds specifically for households with children eligible for TANF.

Comments: Helps the state understand who is impacted by the new virus, how it spreads, and patient outcomes.

The Governor secured hundreds of thousands of face masks, shields and gloves from private market distributors.

Expand insurance coverage.

Comments: To begin cleaning and disinfecting used N95 respirators.

Community Development Block Grant funds.

Title/Description: Executive order.

Title/Description: Extended statewide social distancing restrictions through April 30th.
Department of Labor is preparing to roll out the unemployment programs outlined in the CARES Act.

The minimum PUA weekly payment will be $174 and top out at $440.

Title/Description: Department of Labor is preparing to roll out the unemployment programs outlined in the CARES Act.
Comments: Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation – This emergency increase in Unemployment Insurance Benefits adds $600 per week in federal benefits to the unemployment benefit amount for COVID-19 unemployment claims, including PUA claims.

Title/Description: Department of Labor is preparing to roll out the unemployment programs outlined in the CARES Act.
Comments: Pandemic Emergency Unemployment Compensation – Allows 13 weeks of federally funded benefits to be added to the end of the normal 26 weeks of benefits.

Title/Description: Department of Labor is preparing to roll out the unemployment programs outlined in the CARES Act.
Comments: Short Time Compensation Programs (also known as Work Share) – Provides federal funding of Short-Time Compensation, a program that allows businesses to uniformly reduce their teammates’ hours while the workers receive a partial unemployment benefit.

Title/Description: Designate every Tuesday as "Takeout Tuesday".
Comments: In an effort to encourage residents to support local dining businesses, the Governor signed a proclamation to designate every Tuesday from March 31st through the end of April 2020 as “Takeout Tuesday”.

Title/Description: Executive order that enables healthcare facilities to expand capacity as the need arises.

Comments: To allow online notary services to take place and to provide regulatory flexibility to banks.
